intro: Pseudoselinum, commonly known as false wormwood, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It consists of several species native to various regions of Europe, Asia, and North Africa. These plants typically have aromatic, often hairy leaves and small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. Pseudoselinum species are often found in dry, rocky habitats and are valued for their ornamental qualities. They are also used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
